item.title: Single-Task Multi-Decoder Network Ensembles
item.description:
Ensemble methods show superior performance, uncertainty estimates, and out-of-distribution robustness. At the same time, they have both a higher memory footprint and latency when it comes to deployment. To overcome the latter while still benefit from the former, we investigated in this project the use of single-task multi-decoder networks. Here, we consider the decoders as the ensemble and use a shared encoder instead. To this end, we investigate variations of the loss, architecture, and data augmentation.

This project was a joint effort with CARIAD SE.

item.title: Universal Adversarial Attacks on Videos
item.description:
Universal adversarial attacks aim at disturbing the prediction of a neural network. In this project, we investigated whether a formulation for video data exist and developed universal adversarial attacks for videos.

This project was a joint effort with the Volkswagen Group.

item.title: Adversarial Robustness of Teacher-Student Networks
item.description:
Teacher-student networks are typically used to distill knowledge from a large neural network to a smaller one. In this project, we investigated whether this paradigm can be used to create teacher-student ensembles having a certain level of adversarial robustness.

The results were published in a paper:

A. Bär, F. Hüger, P. Schlicht, and T. Fingscheidt. On the Robustness of Redundant Teacher-Student Frameworks for Semantic Segmentation (2nd place in the Best Paper Award rallye), in Proc. of CVPR - Workshops, Long Beach, CA, USA, Jun. 2019, pp. 1380 - 1388.

This project was a joint effort with the Volkswagen Group.
